seo.metaTitle: Tear Trough Filler London | Under-Eye Rejuvenation | Dr. SNA Clinic
seo.metaDescription: Revive tired eyes with tear trough filler at Dr. SNA Clinic. Doctor-only injections, cannula technique, and optional PN boosters for bright results.

schema.howPerformed: After applying numbing cream, a tiny flexible cannula (blunt-tipped tube) is gently inserted under your eye. Ultra-light hyaluronic acid gel is carefully placed beneath the hollow, filling the shadow and blending smoothly into your cheek. The cannula glides through tissue rather than piercing—this reduces bruising dramatically. We check symmetry from every angle, massaging gently to ensure natural contour
schema.preparation: Arrive with clean, makeup-free skin. Stop blood-thinning supplements (arnica, fish oil, vitamin E) one week before. Avoid alcohol 48 hours prior. Bring sunglasses for the journey home—eyes may look slightly puffy initially. Eat beforehand as low blood sugar can increase bruising risk. Relax knowing this is one of our most requested confidence-boosters
schema.followup: Apply ice packs for 20 minutes every few hours on day one. Sleep elevated for two nights to minimize swelling. Avoid rubbing or pressing the area for 48 hours. Skip intense workouts, saunas, and alcohol for 24 hours. Makeup can be worn after 24 hours. Attend your 2-week review—we'll assess settling and add tiny touch-ups if needed (complimentary)
schema.outcome: Instantly brighter, more rested eyes. The dark shadow and tired look disappear. Your face looks years younger without anyone knowing you've had treatment. Filler settles beautifully over 2 weeks, blending seamlessly. Results last 12-18 months. You'll stop hearing 'you look tired' and start hearing 'you look amazing'
schema.medicationRequired: Topical numbing cream applied 20 minutes before treatment
schema.treatmentFrequency: Single session with optional 2-week refinement. Most patients maintain results with yearly top-ups as the area metabolizes filler slowly
schema.adverseOutcome: Mild swelling under eyes for 24-48 hours (ice helps). Small bruise possible (concealer covers it). Temporary lumpiness that smooths within days. Very rarely, visible filler lines if too much product used (we use conservative amounts)

seriousAdverseOutcome.name: Vascular occlusion (blocked blood vessel under eye)
seriousAdverseOutcome.probability: Extremely rare (less than 0.01%) when using cannula technique with experienced injectors. We have emergency protocols and reversal agents on-site

contraindication: Active infection or cold sore near treatment area
Severe eye bags requiring surgery (we'll refer you appropriately)
typicalTest: Visual assessment of tear trough depth and shadowing
Vascular mapping to identify blood vessels
clinicalFindings: Dark circles caused by shadowing (not pigmentation)
Volume loss due to aging or genetics
Desire for refreshed look without surgery

overview.content: We evaluate skin thickness, fat pad positioning, and vascularity before selecting the lightest HA fillers or PN boosters. Cannula delivery reduces bruising and allows us to blend seamlessly into the cheek contour. For stubborn pigmentation we combine filler with skin boosters or lasers for full-spectrum brightening.

title: Tear Trough Filler

faq.answer: We use low-density fillers designed for the under-eye, injected in tiny amounts to avoid puffiness. If swelling occurs, it's usually temporary (24-48 hours) and settles naturally.
faq.question: Will tear trough filler cause puffiness?

faq.answer: After 24 hours, once any tiny entry points have closed. We recommend mineral makeup initially to avoid infection risk.
faq.question: How long until I can wear makeup after tear trough filler?
How long does tear trough filler last?
faq.answer: Results typically last 12-18 months. The under-eye area metabolizes filler slowly compared to lips, so touch-ups are usually only needed annually. Some patients enjoy results for 2 years.

faq.question: Does tear trough filler hurt?
faq.answer: We apply topical numbing cream 20 minutes before treatment. The cannula technique we use is gentler than needle injections. Most patients describe mild pressure rather than pain.

faq.question: How much does tear trough filler cost in London?
faq.answer: Our Classic Refresh (1ml filler + review) is £395. The Bright Eyes Protocol with PN booster and LED is £575 (save £95). Consultation fee (£75) is credited toward treatment.

faq.question: Will I bruise from tear trough filler?
faq.answer: Bruising is possible but significantly reduced with our cannula technique. If it occurs, it's usually minor and easily covered with concealer after 24 hours. Avoiding blood thinners beforehand helps.

faq.question: Is tear trough filler safe?
faq.answer: Yes, when performed by experienced injectors using proper technique. We use cannula delivery which is safer than needles in this vascular area. Our doctors have deep understanding of orbital anatomy and we have reversal agents on-site.

faq.question: Can tear trough filler fix dark circles?
faq.answer: If your dark circles are caused by shadowing from hollow troughs, yes—filler will brighten the area significantly. If they're caused by pigmentation, we may recommend combining filler with skin boosters or laser treatments for best results.

We focus on subtlety, safety, and long-term support so your eyes look refreshed—not overfilled.
